mojo.description: The WSDL2Java task creates Java classes and deployment descriptor templates from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: url
parameter.description: Location of input WSDL document.

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: Root directory for emitted files.

parameter.name: role
parameter.description: J2EE development role [client|deploy-client|deploy-server|develop-client|develop-server|server]

parameter.name: container
parameter.description: J2EE container [client|ejb|web|none].

parameter.name: genjava
parameter.description: Generate java files only (Do not run rmic and compile) [true|false]

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: Verbose outout [true|false]

mojo.description: The Java2WSDL command maps a Java class to a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file by following the Java API for XML-based remote procedure call (JAX-RPC) specification. The Java2WSDL command accepts a Java class as input and produces a WSDL file representing the input class. If there is an existing file at the output location, it is overwritten. The WSDL file generated by the Java2WSDL command contains WSDL and XML schema constructs that are automatically derived from the input class. You can override these default values with command-line arguments.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: output
parameter.description: Pathname of wsdl file to create

parameter.name: className
parameter.description: Represents the fully qualified name of one of the following Java classes: * Stateless session EJB remote interface that extends the javax.ejb.EJBObject class * Service Endpoint Interface that extends the java.rmi.Remote class * Java bean

parameter.name: implClass
parameter.description: The Java2WSDL command uses method parameter names to construct the WSDL file message part names. The command automatically obtains the message names from the debug information in the class. If the class is compiled without debug information, or if the class is an interface, the method parameter names are not available. In this case, you can use the -implClass argument to provide an alternative class from which to obtain method parameter names. The impl-class does not need to implement the class if the class is an interface, but it must implement the same methods as class.

parameter.name: namespace
parameter.description: Target namespace for the WSDL file being generated

parameter.name: location
parameter.description: Location or URL of the service

parameter.name: mapNamespace
parameter.description: Namespace to map to

parameter.name: mapPackage
parameter.description: Java package to map

mojo.description: This goal generates WebSphere specific deploymentcode for an ejb jarfile.

parameter.name: mavenproject
parameter.description: This is the pom for the project. Property is read-only (i.e you can not set it)

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: workingDirectory
parameter.description: Temporary directory for the deploy tool to use. If not set, the Java System Property user.home is used. Do not include a trailing pathseparator.

parameter.name: sourceDirectory
parameter.description: Source directory for the deploy tool to use. If not set, the project target directory is used.

parameter.name: targetDirectory
parameter.description: Target directory for the deploy tool to use. If not set, the project target directory is used.

parameter.name: inputJar
parameter.description: Specifies the undeployed EJB Jar file you wish to deploy.

parameter.name: outputJar
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the deployed EJB Jar to create.

parameter.name: codegen
parameter.description: Only generate the deployment code, do not run RMIC or Javac [true].

parameter.name: dbschema
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the database schema to create.

parameter.name: dbvendor
parameter.description: Specifies the type of database the EJBs will use. Some of the valid types are : DB2UDB_V72 DB2UDB_V81 CLOUDSCAPE_V5 DB2UDBOS390_V6 DB2UDBOS390_V7 DB2UDBOS390_V8 DB2UDBISERIES INFORMIX_V73 INFORMIX_V93 INFORMIX_V94 MSSQLSERVER_V7 MSSQLSERVER_2000 ORACLE_V8 ORACLE_V9I SYBASE_V1200 SYBASE_V1250 MYSQL_V323

parameter.name: dynamic
parameter.description: Specifies to enable dynamic query support [true].

parameter.name: keepGenerated
parameter.description: Set to prevent the workingDirectory from being deleted [true].

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: Set to display informational messages [false].

parameter.name: noValidate
parameter.description: Set to disable validation messages [true].

parameter.name: noWarnings
parameter.description: Set to disable warning and informational messages [true].

parameter.name: noInform
parameter.description: Set to disable informational messages [true].

parameter.name: rmicOptions
parameter.description: Allows additional arguments to be passed to the rmic command.

parameter.name: compatible
parameter.description: Set to use WebSphere 3.5 or 4.0 compatible mapping rules [-35|-40].

parameter.name: sqlj
parameter.description: Set to generate SQL/J persistor code [-sqlj].

parameter.name: trace
parameter.description: Set to enable internal deploy tool tracing [true].

parameter.name: failonerror
parameter.description: Set to cause your build to not stop on deploy errors [true].

parameter.name: jvmMaxMemory
parameter.description: Sets maximum size of the memory for the underlying VM. Defaults to -Xmx256m. [-Xmx...M]

parameter.name: targetWAS
parameter.description: Set the server target, to one of: WAS510 WAS502 WAS501 WAS500 Defaults to WAS502

mojo.description: Installs an ear/war/jar file to WebSphere.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: targetDirectory
parameter.description: Directory where ear/jar file to install resides. Default is project target dir.

parameter.name: ear
parameter.description: The ear file you wish to install.

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server on which you want to install the application. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server on which you want to install the application. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server on which you want to install the application. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

mojo.description: This goal lists all the applications installed on a WebSphere Server or Cell.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server on which you want to list applications. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that runs the applications you wish to list. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that runs the applications you wish to list. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that runs the application you wish to uninstall. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that runs the application you wish to uninstall. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that runs the application you wish to uninstall. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: ear
parameter.description: The name of the application you wish to uninstall.

mojo.description: This task enables you to start a standalone server instance. This is not used to start a server controlled by DeploymentManager. Therefore, this task is useful for the Base Application Server, and to start the Node Agent and/or DeploymentManager. If you wish to start a server managed by the Deployment Manager, use the wsadmin task to execute a scripting command

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: noWait
parameter.description: If set, the task with return immediately without waiting for the server to start. [-nowait]

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true, the task will not print any status information. [-quiet]

parameter.name: logFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the file to log the server start information to. [name of logfile]

parameter.name: replaceLog
parameter.description: If true, the task with erase an existing log file, instead of appending. [-replacelog]

parameter.name: trace
parameter.description: If true, the task with print trace information. [-trace]

parameter.name: script
parameter.description: The name of a script file to execute during server startup. [name of scriptfile]

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Amount of time to wait for the server to start. [seconds to wait]

parameter.name: statusPort
parameter.description: Port for the server to send status messages to. [port number]

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: User ID to authenticate with if security is turned on. [username]

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to authenticate with. [password]

mojo.description: This task enables you to stop a standalone server instance. This is not used to stop a server controlled by DeploymentManager. Therefore, this task is useful for the Base Application Server, and to stop the Node Agent and/or DeploymentManager.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to start. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: noWait
parameter.description: If true, the task with return immediately without waiting for the server to start. [-nowait]

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true, the task will not print any status information. [-quiet]

parameter.name: logFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the file to log the server start information to. [logfile name]

parameter.name: replaceLog
parameter.description: If set, the task will erase an existing log file, instead of appending. [-replacelog]

parameter.name: trace
parameter.description: If set, the task will print trace information. [-trace]

parameter.name: script
parameter.description: The name of a script file to execute during server startup. [name of scriptfile]

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: Amount of time to wait for the server to start. [seconds to wait]

parameter.name: statusPort
parameter.description: Port for the server to send status messages to. [port number]

parameter.name: connectionType
parameter.description: Specifies the admin transport type to connect to the server with [SOAP | RMI].

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: User ID to authenticate with if security is turned on. [username]

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to authenticate with. [password]

parameter.name: failonerror
parameter.description: If set causes the build to stop if the task has an error. [-failonerror]

mojo.description: The ServerStatus task enables you to get status on a server instance or all server instances.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to get status for. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to get status for. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server you wish to get status for. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: logFile
parameter.description: Specifies the name of the file to log the server status information to. [logfile name]

parameter.name: replaceLog
parameter.description: If set, the task will erase an existing log file, instead of appending. [-replacelog]

parameter.name: trace
parameter.description: If set, the task will print trace information. [-trace]

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: User ID to authenticate with if security is turned on. [username]

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to authenticate with. [password]

mojo.description: This task enables you to start an existing or newly installed application on a WebSphere Server or in a WebSphere Cell.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that contains the application you whish to start. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the cell that contains the application you whish to start. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the nodethat contains the application you whish to start. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: ear
parameter.description: The name of the application you whish to start.

mojo.description: This task enables you to stop an existing application on a WebSphere Server or in a WebSphere Cell.

parameter.name: wasHome
parameter.description: Location of WebSphere installation (normally the WAS_HOME environment variable). [path to WebSphere]

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: Contains the name of the server that hosts the application you wish to stop. Defaults to server1. [servername]

parameter.name: wasCell
parameter.description: Contains the name of the cell that hosts the application you wish to stop. Defaults to name of server. [cellname]

parameter.name: wasNode
parameter.description: Contains the name of the node that hosts the application you wish to stop. Defaults to name of server. [nodename]

parameter.name: ear
parameter.description: The name of the application you wish to stop.
